result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cesar Vega Hernandez

defendant.name: Vega Hernandez, Cesar
defendant.address: 2319 Chalet Gardens Rd Apt 212, Fitchburg, WI 53711

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 13CF364 & 14CF128 called together at 10:25 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cesar  Vega Hernandez in court with Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck submits amended information in 13CF364

Court discusses that criminal complaint in court file, lists case as 14CF125, but all other documents are listed as 14CF128 - Counsel confirm that must be error on Court's copy of complaint and that the case number should be 128 not 125. Upon request of the Court, ADA Beck provides copy of the State's criminal complaint. Court directs Clerk to scan copy into the Court's file, so the file is accurately reflecting a complaint with the correct case number. Clerk makes copy of State's complaint, provides original back to ADA Beck.
Service of AMENDED information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1 as Amended-13CF364; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 14CF128

On Count #1-13CF364, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 10 years, with conditions:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment, education & counseling/therapy; to commence March 25, 2015 at 6:00 pm  
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Undergo a psychosexual evaluation and follow-through with any recommended treatment or therapy as directed by DOC
--No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 16, unless approved by DOC
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No contact with Enedina Guadelupe Chairez and Alejandro Vega, unless contact is approved by DOC and consented to by Mrs. Guadelupe Chairez and Mr. Vega
--No direct or indirect contact with L.V. (dob: 3/20/2009)
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $215 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program
--To pay 10% resitution processing fee
--Be Liable for any future costs of counseling, psychological or psychiatric case costs of L.V. (dob: 3/20/09), up to maximum of $10,000, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 973.20(4m)
--Sex offender registration & reporting
--To pay $408 subpoena fees
--TO pay $115 subpoena fees (14CF128)
Court authorizes jail sentence to transfer to Dane County as long as electronic monitoring is not authorized

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:02 am
Motion hearing on February 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
State's
State's
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on February 16 & 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Cases 13CF364 & 14CF128 called together at 1:59 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cesar  Vega Hernandez in court with Attorney Adam Nero on behalf of Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Nero: Requests 13CF364 be set for oral arguments on motion & trial dates on both files
ADA Beck: Agreed; Requests 2 days on 13CF364 & 1 day on 14CF128
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Beck indicates that they could be ready on 14 file in about 30 days. 13 file need at least 60, presents basis
Atty Nero: No preference in order of cases being scheduled for trial
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicate that they will submit some arguments prior to motion
Court orders any Defense Argument Brief by November 14th
Court orders any State Argument Brief by December 1st
Court/Counsel discuss scheduling - Court informs parties that It will have Court's JA set for trial.
Court directs Atty Nero to communicate to Atty Schmeiser that she needs to contact the Court's JA within 3 days to schedule trial dates and that she should include the State on scheduling call.
ADA Beck addresses State's Motions to Admit Stepwise videos, Court indicates that they can address that on 12/4
Court reminds Mr. Vega Hernandez that his bond/condtions of release remain in effect while cases are pending
Recess: 2:10 pm 

NEXT: 13CF364: (1) Schedule Motion Hearing (to Admit Stepwise Video)/Oral Arguments 12/4/14 at 9:00 am (30 minutes) - Send notices 
BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule FSSC & JT (2 days)  - Send notices **COUNSEL TO CONTACT COURT'S JA WITHIN 3 DAYS**
Status conference on October 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Cases 13CF364 & 14CF128 called together at 8:53 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cesar  Vega Hernandez in court with Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Schmeiser: Had requested 45 days for risk assessment, this has been completed & findings have been provided to ADA Beck. Requests additional 30 days to review material and have further negotiations.
ADA Beck: Agreed - do believe will have answer in 30 days on how case will proceed, holding motions open
Court presents concerns regarding age of 13CF364, presents basis and grants adjournment. Court informs parties that if case is not settled at next STC, then 13CF364 will be set on the trial calendar.
Court directs Atty Schmeiser to call the Court's JA today to schedule next date
Court reminds Mr. Hernandez that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Court informs parties that if there is agreement, would at least like to take plea at next scheduled date
Recess: 8:59 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule STC in 30 - 45 days with Judge Koschnick, not reserve - Send notices **Atty Schmeiser to contact the Court's JA for scheduling**
Motion hearing on September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court notes on cover letter that a hearing is needed
States demand w/cover letter
Defendant's Motion for Extension of time to file Motions to Suppress
Defendant's Request for Production of Exculpatory Evidence
Defendant's Motion for Discovery of other Conduct Evidence
Defendant's
Defendant's Motion for Production of Physical Evidence
Defendant's Notice of Motions
Status conference on September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 13CF364 & 14CF128 called together at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cesar Vega Hernandez in court with Attorney Sarah M Schmeiser. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Schmeiser: Requests that motions to admit step-wise video & step-wise video of witness be held open and matters be set as following for 13CF364 for STC and 14CF128 for waiver of preliminary hearing in approx. 45 days, presents basis.
ADA Beck confirms this is request of parties, no objection to holding open motions and scheduling as requested, presents basis
Court inquires of parties why waiver of preliminary hearing can not be heard today, as It is not inclined to delay preliminary hearing for 45 days
Atty Schmeiser indicates that they can proceed with waiver today
Recess: 11:24 am for Atty Schmeiser for complete paperwork Reconvene: 11:31 am 

14CF128: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Hernandez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--Defendant stands Mute; pleas of "not guilty" entered
 on Defendant's behalf
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 11:34 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) STC scheduled for 9/11/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on July 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.

13CF364 and 14CF1285 - Stipulation and order  for continuance of the status conf. and motion hearing currently scheduled on 5/22/14.  
In case 13CF364 the motion is granted conditioned upon defense counsel filing a stipulation and proposed order to substitute attorneys by 5/30/14.
for Continuance of the Status Conference which is scheduled for 05-22-2014 at 1:30 pm
Status conference on May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Judge Weston presiding for Branch III Intake: 
case called at 1:34pm. 
Defendant Cesar Vega Hernandez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Sarah Schmeiser.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
On Motion of ADA Teuber, the Court amends the Criminal Complaint to correct the Jefferson County Jail address in the second paragraph of the factual section. The Court amends the Complaint in its own hand.

The Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--not to discuss this case with any employee of the Chuck-E-Cheese at which he was employed
--shall not obtain employment or engage in any volunteer activity in any location which would involve contact with minor children
--no contact with any minor children except as necessary for school purposes
--booking at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today
recess 1:-44pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/14/14 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 5/22/14 at 1:30pm.
